page.title: 06MOFFAT FIRE STATION
page.content: First commisioned in September 1979 this attractive modern building,with raised rose beds and bench for the weary walker,at first glance masks its serious purpose.Situated on the road to Selkirk yet within easy reach of the town the Station is 'home' for Moffat's retained force.11 firemen(1 Sub-officer,1Leading Fireman and 9 firemen)are available to answer any call,night or day;leaving their normal jobs and even their beds to do so.A 999 call will within moments alert the force by means of the radio pagers carried at all times by each man.The call may be to a forest fire,a road accident,a chimney fire or even a horse stuck in a pit! Its all in a day's work for a rural force,embracing occupations such as mechanics,a teacher and self employed persons.The current vehicle is a Dodge 500.
